bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 120 (Wednesday, July 20, 2022)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. LEE of Nevada:H.R. 8434.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 1 provides Congress with thepower to ``lay and collect Taxes, Duties, Imposts andExcises'' in order to ``provide for the . . . general Welfareof the United States.''[Page H6922]

item.title: Facilitating Large-Scale Water Recycling and Reuse Projects Act

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

summary.text:
Facilitating Large-Scale Water Recycling and Reuse Projects Act

This bill modifies the Bureau of Reclamation's Large-Scale Water Recycling Program, which provides grants to water and power delivery authorities in certain western states for the planning, design, and construction of large-scale water recycling and reuse projects that have a total cost of $500 million or more. Specifically, the bill removes the program's sunset provision and revises eligibility requirements.

bill.title: Facilitating Large-Scale Water Recycling and Reuse Projects Act

item.title: Facilitating Large-Scale Water Recycling and Reuse Projects Act
Facilitating Large-Scale Water Recycling and Reuse Projects Act

To amend the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act to modify the requirements for an eligible project under the competitive grant program for large-scale water recycling and reuse projects, to provide for an additional authorization of appropriations for that program, to repeal the termination of authority for that program, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
